items.text: beats the outside edge as he presses forward to try and defend this dipping ball outside off
items.shortText: Cremer to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: back of a length on middle stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
good length on leg stump, stretches forward and flicks to short fine
items.shortText: Cremer to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: full outside off, flicks on the rise to long-on
checks the hook and just manages to clear midwicket. Short ball gets big on him at an off stump line and he's not confident as he plays the shot
back of a length and in at off stump. Inside edge onto boot as he hangs the bat at this away from the body
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: short of a length ball nudged into the square leg area with the angle
short ball slanted across off stump and he ramps it towards third man
short ball spits up at him and comes into his chest. He looks to guide it to third man and ends up gloving it narrowly past the keeper
good length outside off, steered to third man

outfoxes him! Cremer gets another one with the googly. Good length ball on off stump, hung up generously and dipping fast. Tamim steps out and wants to slog this over the midwicket boundary, but it turns away from him and he's woefully out of shape by the end of it all. Easy stumping for Taylor

dismissal.text: Tamim Iqbal st †Taylor b Cremer 76 (105b 6x4 0x6) SR: 72.38

items.text: length ball just outside off, stabbed through point on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
items.shortText: Cremer to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: back of a length just outside off stump, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
googly lifts up at Nasir as he presses forward for the defence. Forced to jab it into the turf
items.shortText: Cremer to Nasir Hossain, no run

items.text: good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
items.postText:
Souradeep: "Exactly the thing I was worried about! Not rotating the strike while it was needed caused the pressure here, and now we can see that our key batsmen are throwing their wickets away! "

Janet James: "Cremer uses the googly more effectively than most of the world's top leg spinners in my humble opinion." --- In that he hardly uses it at all.
items.shortText: Cremer to Nasir Hossain, no run

items.text: good length and just outside off, defended to point
items.shortText: Jarvis to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: inside edge zips past the stumps as he tried to chop this length ball outside off. Didn't get close enough to the ball and it slid low. Fine leg cleans up

Ervine has plucked out a stunner! This is something! He's leaped one-handed to his left at short midwicket and somehow got his hand under it. Superb. It's a short ball from Jarvis, on a middle and off line. The pull shot is nailed off the middle of the bat and dips on Ervine, but he's got down rapidly and done this with some craft. Despite the speed at which he had to move, he completes the catch nicely with a soft landing and a firm elbow

dismissal.text: Sabbir Rahman c Ervine b Jarvis 6 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 54.54

items.text: back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
items.shortText: Jarvis to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: back of a length just outside off, drops it into the turf in front of point
items.shortText: Jarvis to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, can't beat Raza at backward point as he stabs at this with no feet
items.postText: eddie: "This is a collapse. Nasir and Mashrafe have to look to bat all 50 overs themselves, perhaps hitting out only in the last 2 or 3 overs. Target 220."
items.shortText: Jarvis to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: tossed up on middle stump, watches it come on and pushes it back to the bowler
items.shortText: Cremer to Nasir Hossain, no run

items.text: back of a length and pushed through in the corridor, hurriedly tapped to extra cover
items.shortText: Cremer to Nasir Hossain, no run

items.text: back of a length and in at the pads, dabbed through midwicket off the back foot
